MASSACRE.Definition: the killing of a large number of people, especially in a cruel or violent manner

TREACHERY.Definition: involving betrayal of trust or dishonest behaviour

BOASTS.Definition: talks with pride or self-satisfaction about

DISTILLED.Definition: made stronger or purer by heating them and then cooling them again

BAN.Definition: prohibition or the state of not being allowed

TREACHEROUS.Definition: involving betrayal of trust or dishonest behaviour

ALLIANCES.Definition: unions or associations formed for mutual benefit

INHERIT.Definition: receive after the death of the previous holder

GOODWILL.Definition: friendly or cooperative attitude or disposition

HATCHED.Definition: brought into existence, devised or planned

EXILE.Definition: the state of being sent away from his country for political reasons

HOP.Definition: move quickly and lightly from one place to another

CULMINATED.Definition: reached the highest or decisive point

BEATS IT.Definition: is superior to or surpasses it

CLAN.Definition: a group of people, similar to a tribe

CLANS.Definition: groups of people, similar to tribes

HEIR.Definition: a person legally entitled to it

THRONE.Definition: the chair of state for a king or queen

THREAT.Definition: something likely to cause damage or danger

BIDING THEIR TIME.Definition: waiting patiently for a favourable opportunity or moment

OUTPOSTS.Definition: military bases or settlements at a distance from the main settlement or headquarters

QUASH.Definition: suppress or put an end to forcefully

EXILED.Definition: forced to leave his country for political reasons

REBELLION.Definition: open resistance to the government or ruler

PLEDGED ALLIANCE.Definition: made a formal promise to be loyal or committed to them

DEADLINE.Definition: the latest time or date by which it should have been completed

GARRISONED.Definition: put or positioned in order to live there and defend it

HOSPITALITY.Definition: friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers

AT POINT BLANK RANGE.Definition: at very close range, at a distance so close that it was impossible to miss the target

MASSACRING.Definition: killing (a large number of people) violently and cruelly

STABBING.Definition: hitting (with a pointed weapon) with force

BAYONETS.Definition: long, sharp blades fixed on to their rifles (long guns)

EXPOSURE.Definition: being affected by the elements or a harmful situation

TURNED A BLIND EYE.Definition: pretended not to notice or ignored

PULLING THE STRINGS.Definition: controlling the situation in a secret way

OVERSTATE.Definition: exaggerate or make it seem more important than it really is

URBAN MYTH.Definition: a widely held but false belief or idea, often repeated by popular culture

TRIGGER.Definition: the part of a gun that causes the gun to fire when pressed

BUTCHER.Definition: the person who did the brutal or violent killing

QUEST.Definition: a long pursuit or search for it
